title: A shopkeeper purchased a television set for Rs. 5,000 and spent Rs. 500 for its repair. If he wants to sell it for a 5% profit, then what should be the selling price? - Quora

response.answer_text: Total cost to shopkeeper = 5000 +500 = 5500. Sale price with 5% profit = (100 + 5)/ 100 * total cost = 1.05 * 5500 = 5775.
If the shop keeper wants to sell at 5% profit on cost price then he has to sell for 5775. If he wants to have a profit of 5% on selling price then he has to sell for 5789.47.

Total cost = 5000 + 500 = 5500 5% of cost = 275 , (assuming he dont have to spend anything for transport etc since it is not given as part of the question) So in order to make 5% profit, the shopkeeper need to sell it for 5775 Rs.
